title: ITR filing FY 2024-25 due date extended! What’s the new deadline? Check details
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: In a welcome move for taxpayers, the Income Tax Department has further extended the deadline for filing Income Tax Returns (ITR) for the Assessment Year 2025-26. Originally due on July 31, 2025, and previously extended to September 15, 2025, the new deadline is now September 16, 2025.

title: Delhi’s sex ratio dips to 920, falling for 4th year
content: Delhi's sex ratio at birth has declined for the fourth consecutive year, reaching 920 females per 1,000 males in 2024, raising concerns about illegal prenatal sex determination. The city also experienced a decrease in registered births alongside an increase in deaths.

title: 'Amounts to theft': Russia furious over frozen assets; warns it will 'go after' EU states
content: Russia has issued a warning. It says it will target any European nation that tries to seize its assets. This follows reports that the European Union is exploring ways to use frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine. Russia considers any seizure of its assets as theft.

title: iOS 26 roll out today: List of supported iPhones; how to download
content: Apple's 2025 event unveiled the iPhone 17 series and iPhone Air, with iOS 26 launching publicly on September 15th. The update will be available for iPhones as old as iPhone 11 and SE (2nd gen). New features include a Liquid Glass interface, smarter Siri, redesigned Photos app, and iPhone Mirroring on Mac. Select models will support Apple Intelligence features.

title: After throwing spanner in the works, Trump mandarins trying to salvage trade deals
content: Trump's tariffs on imported hand tools from China, India, and Vietnam are poised to raise prices for American consumers as existing inventories deplete. Indian exporters initially surged shipments to the US before the tariffs took full effect, but now face challenges competing with Vietnam due to increased duties.

title: ‘We will do better’: Microsoft CEO acknowledges ‘lack of empathy’; meets with staff
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella acknowledged the need to rebuild trust with employees following layoffs and a return-to-office mandate. He addressed concerns about a perceived lack of empathy and the challenges of remote work, particularly for new hires. Nadella also cautioned staff about future business challenges and the need for renewal.

title: IND vs PAK: Another twist! ICC unlikely to accept PCB demand
content: The ICC is likely to reject the PCB's demand to remove match referee Andy Pycroft, following allegations that he instructed captains not to shake hands. Sources suggest Pycroft may have been acting on instructions from the ACC. The PCB, led by chief Mohsin Naqvi, threatened to withdraw from the tournament if their demand wasn't met.

title: SC on Waqf Act: What top court stayed, what’s in force — All you need to know
content: The Supreme Court has addressed the Waqf (Amendment) Act. The court upheld the law's constitutionality. However, some key provisions are now on hold. These include rules about who can create Waqf. Also stayed is the process for designating property. The Central Waqf Council must limit non-Muslim members. The court seeks to balance interests while the law is reviewed.

title: ITR filing due date today: Tax department shares quick guide
content: The Income Tax Department advises taxpayers facing e-filing portal access issues to address local browser or device settings. Simple steps like clearing cache, using supported browsers, and disabling extensions can resolve common problems.

title: Gemini Nano Banana AI Saree: What it this new trend; how you can create photos
content: Following the Nano Banana AI 3D figurine craze, the 'Banana AI Saree' trend has emerged on Instagram. Users are transforming selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits using Google’s Gemini Nano Banana image editing tool. The AI crafts images with chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, mimicking classic Bollywood aesthetics with popular styles like polka-dot and floral sarees.

title: Hailee Steinfeld: Josh Allen’s wife gets candid — Niall Horan song revealed
content: Josh Allen, the Buffalo Bills' celebrated quarterback, and Hailee Steinfeld, the BAFTA-nominated actress, tied the knot in May 2025 after dating for two years. Before Allen, Steinfeld was linked to Niall Horan, even penning a song, "Wrong Direction," speculated to be about their relationship. Despite past relationships, Steinfeld has found happiness with Allen, with their engagement occurring in late 2024.

title: After handshake drama rocks Asia Cup, India qualify for Super 4s; Pakistan on brink of elimination
content: India has secured its place in the Super 4 stage of the Asia Cup 2025 after the UAE's victory over Oman. With India's progression, the upcoming India-Oman match is now inconsequential.

title: Savannah James: 'I never fully adjusted to the spotlight'
content: Savannah James, wife of LeBron James, maintains a low public profile despite her husband's fame, expressing discomfort with red carpets and TV appearances. She prioritizes family privacy while supporting LeBron's philanthropic work and athletic dedication. Together since 2004, they navigate life in Los Angeles, actively supporting their son Bronny's basketball career.

title: Fans slam NFL’s Charlie Kirk tribute at Lambeau Field
content: The NFL and Green Bay Packers honored Charlie Kirk with a moment of silence before facing the Washington Commanders. Fans called it rushed and poorly executed, slamming the league for inconsistency compared to past public statements. Kirk, 31, was killed Wednesday in Utah. The tribute came as Trump vowed to award him the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Orca Wiesblatt, 25: Star dies in crash — Rock Lobsters mourn fearless lead
content: Professional hockey player Orca Wiesblatt tragically died in a traffic accident near Nanaimo, British Columbia. The 25-year-old, recently signed with the Allen Americans, was remembered by his former team, the Athens Rock Lobsters, for his energy, toughness, and infectious smile. Tributes poured in, highlighting his on-ice skills and positive impact as a teammate, leaving a void in the hockey community.

title: Advance tax deadline: Who pays, who is exempt and what penalty applies - explained
content: Indian taxpayers, brace yourselves! The second advance tax installment for FY 2025-26 is due September 15th. If your tax liability exceeds Rs 10,000, pay up to avoid a 1% monthly interest penalty. Salaried individuals with additional income beyond TDS deductions, and others, should take note. Senior citizens are exempt under specific conditions.

title: Not red meat, not butter: These 5 everyday habits may be causing heart attacks
content: Increasing evidence suggests that modern foods and lifestyle patterns undermine nitric oxide production, crucial for cardiovascular health. Refined sugar, starches, industrial seed oils, smoking, and antibacterial mouthwash deplete nitric oxide, increasing the risk of heart disease. Conversely, leafy greens, beets, garlic, citrus fruits, nuts, and regular exercise can boost nitric oxide levels and support heart health.

title: Sophia Romano: Gaethje’s girlfriend revealed — model, influencer on rise
content: Sophia Romano is a social media influencer. She is also a model. Sophia is known for her relationship with Justin Gaethje. He is a UFC star. They met on a dating app. Sophia worked in media production before modeling. She supports Gaethje at his UFC fights. Sophia creates content and engages with fans. She is building her own brand.

title: 'India coming to table': Navarro's odd remark as US official flies to Delhi for trade talks
content: Amidst ongoing trade deal discussions, US President Donald Trump's advisor Peter Navarro criticized India's high tariffs and Russian oil purchases, alleging it funds Russia's war efforts. Despite these tensions, a US trade negotiator is in India for preliminary talks, aiming to revive the suspended bilateral trade agreement negotiations.

title: Stephanie Niles: Jake Browning’s girlfriend stuns — postgame look goes viral
content: Jake Browning played for Bengals. His girlfriend, Stephanie Niles, gained attention. Niles wore a bold outfit with Browning's jersey number. Her look went viral on social media. Many fans praised her style. Some found it too revealing. Niles and Browning are engaged. They often share their relationship online. The couple's interaction after the game was sweet.

title: Asia Cup: Next India vs Pak match in danger? Latest developments
content: Tensions escalate as Pakistan threatens to boycott remaining Asia Cup 2025 matches if match referee Andy Pycroft isn't removed. PCB alleges Pycroft instructed their captain to avoid handshakes with India, further accusing Suryakumar Yadav of unsportsmanlike conduct post-match. India's captain dedicated the win to terror attack victims and armed forces, adding fuel to the fire.

title: California officially recognizes Diwali as a public holiday
content: California has officially declared Diwali a public holiday, joining a growing number of states recognizing the festival of lights. The AB 268 Bill, championed by Assembly Members Ash Kalra and Dr. Darshana Patel, received overwhelming legislative support. This move acknowledges the significant Indian diaspora and promotes inclusivity within American society.

title: 'Hellbent on insulting Bihar': PM Modi attacks Congress over 'bidi' post
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi strongly criticized the Congress-RJD alliance, citing a controversial social media post by Kerala Congress that compared Bihar to a bidi. Modi accused the opposition of insulting Bihar and vowed to stop infiltration allegedly encouraged by them.

title: Trade deficit narrows: India’s exports rose in August - when Trump’s tariffs took effect
content: India's exports saw a rise in August despite new US tariffs, driven by front-loading of shipments. The trade deficit narrowed, although it exceeded predictions. While exports to the US increased between April and August, India is diversifying markets and seeking trade deals with the EU to mitigate supply chain risks and reduce import reliance.

title: 'Jalebi Baby' Pakistan anthem blunder; artist Tesher says 'shout out to the sound guy'
content: The Asia Cup 2025 match between India and Pakistan faced an unusual start with 'Jalebi Baby' mistakenly played instead of Pakistan's anthem, prompting a complaint from the PCB. India secured a dominant seven-wicket victory, chasing down Pakistan's 128-run target, led by Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 47. Kuldeep Yadav's stellar bowling earned him Player of the Match for the second consecutive game.

title: 'Leader sitting with us': Nitish goes off script; 'reveals' what led to JD(U)-BJP split
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar attributed his 2022 split from the BJP to internal dissent within his own party, the JD(U), during a rally in Purnea. He pledged unwavering future alliance with the BJP, despite past coalition fluctuations. Nitish's remarks spotlighted Lallan Singh, hinting at his role in the earlier discord.

title: 'I will not go anywhere': Why Nitish is pledging loyalty to NDA, again & again
content: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, attempting to solidify his commitment to the NDA, publicly affirmed his allegiance in the presence of PM Modi, addressing his past political shifts and blaming his party members for switching sides.

title: Abhishek Sharma posts two-word message after going after Shaheen Afridi
content: In the Asia Cup 2025 clash, Kuldeep Yadav's bowling and Jasprit Bumrah's contribution restricted Pakistan to a modest total. Abhishek Sharma then ignited India's chase with a rapidfire innings, smashing Shaheen Afridi for boundaries and sixes. His quickfire 31 set the stage for India's comfortable seven-wicket victory, prompting a patriotic message from the young opener.

title: 'I will have to do all the talking': Trump on Ukraine-Russia peace deal
content: Donald Trump stated that a face-to-face meeting between Zelenskyy and Putin is unlikely due to intense personal animosity. He expressed his intention to personally intervene, highlighting the difficulty in resolving the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Despite diplomatic efforts and prisoner exchanges, Moscow continues its offensive, while Ukraine rejects territorial concessions, leading to ongoing challenges in achieving peace.

title: Grand Swiss: Dutch no. 1 Anish Giri wins title; Candidates 2026 spot sealed
content: Anish Giri and Matthias Bluebaum secured their spots in the FIDE Candidates Tournament 2026 after a strong showing at the FIDE Grand Swiss. R Vaishali defended her title in the women's event, marking her second appearance in the Women’s Candidates Tournament 2026. With Caruana and Nakamura also confirmed, the Candidates Tournament is set to be highly competitive.

title: Explained: How private candidates can take additional subjects in CBSE exams
content: CBSE has clarified the eligibility rules for private candidates taking additional subjects in Classes 10 and 12. Only students previously studying the subject and placed in 'Compartment' or 'Essential Repeat' categories are eligible. Stringent requirements include a two-year study period, minimum 75% attendance, and completion of internal assessments to maintain academic standards.

title: TikTok's return: Video app will switch to US-controlled ownership
content: Americans may continue using TikTok. A framework deal transfers TikTok's ownership to US control. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced this after US-China trade talks in Spain. Trump and Chinese Premier Xi Jinping may finalize the agreement soon. The deal addresses national security concerns. TikTok's popularity soared during Covid-19 lockdowns. US officials worried about ByteDance's Chinese origins.

title: New IRCTC train ticket rules: From Oct 1, Aadhaar authentication must; what it means
content: Starting October 1, 2025, Indian Railways will mandate Aadhaar authentication for booking reserved general tickets via IRCTC during the first 15 minutes of reservation opening.

title: India vs Pakistan controversy: Why handshakes matter in cricket — rules and protocols explained
content: Tensions flared between the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) and India after the Asia Cup match, with the PCB demanding the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft. This demand follows Indian players' refusal to shake hands with their Pakistani counterparts, a gesture made in solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 'Gone very well': Trump hails US-China trade talks; will speak to Xi soon
content: President Trump hinted at a potential breakthrough regarding TikTok's future as US-China trade talks progressed in Madrid. He suggested a deal was reached for the popular app, pleasing young users, while also mentioning upcoming discussions with President Xi. These developments occurred amidst ongoing trade negotiations, with both countries seeking to resolve economic and trade disputes, including the TikTok issue.

title: Gaza war: Rubio meets Netanyahu; Qatar levels serious charge against Israel
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio affirmed support for Qatar's Gaza mediation after Israeli strikes, despite prior criticism from Rubio and President Trump. Netanyahu defended the strikes targeting Hamas, comparing them to post-9/11 US actions against terrorists. He asserted that harboring terrorists negates sovereignty.

title: Historic! Vaishali wins Women's Grand Swiss; now 3rd Indian to enter Candidates
content: R Vaishali defended her FIDE Women’s Grand Swiss title in 2025, securing a spot in the 2026 Candidates Tournament. She finished with 8 points after drawing against Tan Zhongyi. Vaishali joins Koneru Humpy and Divya Deshmukh as the third Indian woman to qualify for the Candidates, marking a significant achievement for Indian women's chess.

title: Savannah James: LeBron’s wife goes viral — quirky video sparks buzz
content: Savannah James recently shared personal facts in a "Get Unready With Me" video, revealing details about her dream car and skincare routine. Meanwhile, LeBron James celebrated their wedding anniversary with a heartfelt Instagram message and a romantic dance clip. The couple, together for over two decades, marked another milestone in their enduring love story.

title: Pope Leo slams Elon Musk: Vatican finances under scrutiny, how much is the Pontiff paid??
content: Pope Leo has criticised the vast disparity between CEO and worker pay, citing Elon Musk's compensation. The Vatican's wealth, accumulated over centuries through property, donations, and investments, includes over 5,400 properties valued at €2.6 billion. While the Pope earns a substantial salary, the Vatican faces financial challenges, including a reported deficit that led to salary cuts for cardinals. Read below!

title: Trade deal soon? US chief negotiator to land in India tonight; talks begin tomorrow
content: Amidst signs of easing trade tensions, the US chief negotiator is set to arrive in India tonight, paving the way for renewed trade discussions starting tomorrow. This visit follows recent social media exchanges between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump, indicating a potential thaw in relations previously strained by US tariffs on Indian imports, particularly concerning Russian oil purchases.

title: Handshake row takes ugly turn: Pak threaten to withdraw from Asia Cup
content: Tensions escalate at the Asia Cup as Pakistan threaten withdrawal if match referee Andy Pycroft isn't removed. The PCB formally complained to the ICC, alleging Code of Conduct violations after a handshake controversy during the India-Pakistan match. Pakistan alleges Pycroft instructed their captain to avoid shaking hands, and expressed disappointment at India's post-match behavior.

title: 'I've kind of been nobody's favorite player': Why Geno Smith believes he fits with the Raiders at age 34
content: Geno Smith spent seven years in Seattle and says he never felt fully comfortable with what he always felt was Russell Wilson's team.

title: 'What's your deal?': Jim Harbaugh-Pete Carroll rivalry timeline
content: The Chargers-Raiders "Monday Night Football" matchup marks a renewal of a beef almost two decades long.

title: Commanders' Daniels has knee injury, status iffy
content: Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels has a knee injury that has his status for Sunday's game against the Las Vegas Raiders in question.

title: Sources: Vikes' McCarthy (ankle) out 2-4 weeks
content: Vikings QB J.J. McCarthy is expected to miss two to four weeks with a high ankle sprain, sources told ESPN, and Carson Wentz is expected to start in his place.

title: LSU's Kelly apologizes to reporter for tirade
content: SU coach Brian Kelly apologized for snapping at a reporter following Saturday's 20-10 victory against Florida.

title: Sources: Burrow (toe surgery) to miss 3 months
content: Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow will undergo toe surgery, said coach Zac Taylor on Monday, and it will sideline him a minimum of three months, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Arch vows to be better as SEC play approaches
content: Texas quarterback Arch Manning says he and the team will play better as the 8th-ranked Longhorns prepare for their final game before their SEC schedule starts.

title: Sources: Star Bears CB Johnson out indefinitely
content: Chicago Bears Pro Bowl cornerback Jaylon Johnson is out indefinitely with a groin injury, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter and Courtney Cronin on Monday.

title: Cowboys' Beebe out 6-8 weeks with ankle sprain
content: Cowboys executive vice president Stephen Jones confirmed Monday that center Cooper Beebe will miss six to eight weeks with a right ankle sprain.

title: Source: Surging Giants calling up top prospect
content: The Giants, suddenly back in the playoff race with two weeks left in the regular season, are calling up top prospect Bryce Eldrige, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: 'They have the most complete team': MLB insiders weigh in on October's teams to beat
content: In a year with no 100-game winners atop the standings, here's who those around the sport think could make a deep postseason run.

title: Joe Burrow out with turf toe: What is it, and what will 3 months away mean for the QB, Bengals?
content: Jake Browning helped deliver a win to the Bengals on Sunday, but what's reasonable to expect from the backup?

title: Barnwell picks apart three wild Week 2 endings, from the Cowboys' big kick to the Jaguars' collapse
content: Bill Barnwell sorts through fourth-quarter fireworks in Giants-Cowboys, Broncos-Colts and Jaguars-Bengals.

title: From dormant to dominant: Why Dominique Malonga could save the Storm
content: The Storm knew all along Dominique Malonga would emerge as a key part of their WNBA title hopes -- whether it's this year or in years to come.

title: Pickups: Daniel Jones among top options to replace Joe Burrow
content: Highlighting available QBs for those who roster Burrow, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 3.

title: Buzz: Hunter plays both ways, Judkins debuts, Burrow injury and more from Sunday
content: Travis Hunter was pressed into extra DB service, the Bengals win with Jake Browning and more Sunday takeaways

title: How Karina Tovar, the NFL's first Latina ref, became a trailblazer
content: To kick off Hispanic Heritage Month, the daughter of Mexican immigrants discussed how her love of football turned into a pioneering journey.

title: Week 3 takeaways: Texas A&M's off to a hot start; UCLA ... not so much
content: After exciting wins and disappointing losses, we take a look at the biggest storylines following Week 3.

title: Wrestlepalooza 2025: Date, time, channel, card, how to watch
content: ESPN is excited to present the first annual Wrestlepalooza on Saturday. Check out how to watch John Cena, Seth Rollins and other WWE stars.

title: Inside the Warriors' stalemate with Jonathan Kuminga
content: Kuminga's future with the Warriors will determine how the team fills its remaining roster spots as training camp nears.

title: Philadelphia's virtual jabs at Kansas City lead NFL Week 2 trolls
content: The San Francisco 49ers also made sure to poke fun at the New Orleans Saints after winning on the road, leading Week 2's NFL trolls.

title: Champions League storylines: Will Arsenal win it all, PSG repeat, Barca rebound?
content: The UEFA Champions League kicks into high gear on Tuesday. But who are the favorites? How about the fashionable outsiders? Mark Ogden weighs in on the big clubs and talking points.

title: Man City's big men step up vs. Man United, lucky Liverpool, Madrid's ref déjà vu, more
content: Man City's "big men" came up big in Sunday's derby win, Liverpool get lucky (again) and Real Madrid have more complaints about the referees in LaLiga, as Gab Marcotti explains the weekend.

title: MLS: Did Müller, Vancouver just leapfrog the league's best?
content: Thomas Müller and Vancouver trounced Philly 7-0, so was it enough to dethrone the leaders of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Barcelona eye Stiller
content: Both Real Madrid and Barcelona are looking at a move for Stuttgart midfielder Angelo Stiller. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Bihar Minister announces laptops for top engineering, polytechnic students
content: At present, the award carries a medal, certificate, memento and cash reward of ₹5,000, ₹4,000 and ₹3,000 for students securing first, second and third position at state level in engineering and polytechnic colleges

title: More than 6 million children in Maharashtra have non-communicable diseases, say experts
content: The burden is not just medical but social and financial and parents are pushed into debt for recurring costs and children suffer isolation in schools, say doctors

title: Odisha attracted investment of ₹5.6 lakh crore, created 1.64 lakh jobs in 15 months, says CM
content: Foundation stones for 27 industrial projects across 12 districts entailing investment of ₹25,000 crore laid virtually by State CM Mohan Majhi

title: Normal rainfall during southwest monsoon, says Regional Meteorological Centre
content: However, these numbers are not final and are bound to change since the end of the season is September 30. Meanwhile, the southwest monsoon began its withdrawal from Rajasthan on Sunday

title: Press Club of India asks A.P. Chief Minister to stop police from targeting journalists
content: Says media fraternity is concerned by what they called ‘systematic hounding’ of the editor and journalists of Sakshi newspaper by A.P. Police for publishing routine news

title: CCMB scientists crack cells’ secret to shape-shifting
content: When a cell needs to form a new shape or protrusion, it must generate a fresh meshwork of actin that pushes in the desired direction

title: Hyderabad floods: Parsigutta families escaped death by a whisker
content: Decrepit retaining wall, part of which lay as a heap of heavy boulders now, hardly protected their homes, because water oozed from the catch-pits and flowed as a current from upper regions

title: Tejashwi Yadav slams Bihar Minister for ‘assaulting’ Youtuber
content: The RJD leader alleged that the YouTuber, Dilip Kumar Sahani, was beaten up and abused by the Minister for asking questions on the poor condition of the roads

title: ITR filing deadline extended by a day to September 16
content: The extension in the ITR deadline came after chartered accountants and individuals took to social media to complain of glitches on the e-filing portal

title: As monsoon retreats, Kerala likely to see below-normal rainfall
content: The State has received a total of 1,612.6 mm of rainfall as of September 15 against the seasonal average of 1,888.2 mm of rain, a shortfall of 15%

title: Govt. names advisory and pastor welfare panels
content: Cardinal Antony Poola,  Metropolitan Archbishop of Hyderabad and Rev Reuben Mark, Moderator of Church of South India named members of Advisory panel

title: Newly proposed 30% export duty will further hurt Karnataka’s iron ore, steel sectors: FIMI
content: The Centre’s recent proposal to fix export duty on low-grade iron ore at 30% from the earlier 0% will only worsen the situation of both mining and steel production in Karnataka

title: Sharad Pawar slams CM Fadnavis for ‘ignoring’ plight of farmers, says ‘learn’ from Nepal’s situation
content: NCP-SP chief said CM Devendra Fadnavis should “learn” from Nepal’s political situation; he said his party will not be a “bystander” if the government does not address the State’s farm distress

title: BJP will be wiped out from U.P. in 2027 Assembly polls, says Akhilesh
content: The Samajwadi Party chief says the State government is not running as per the Constitution and law and the BJP is working like a gang. The BJP government has ruined education, health, and law and order, he says.

title: Watch: Portraying Gandhi is a huge commitment: Pratik Gandhi | TIFF 2025
content: Film critic Meenakshi Shedde caught up with Hansal Mehta, producer Sameer Nair and lead actors Pratik Gandhi and Bhamini Oza in Toronto.

title: Two killed, several injured as truck runs over people in Indore; vehicle catches fire
content: Police officer says the truck driver and his helper have been detained; a video of the vehicle engulfed in fire on a busy road of the city also surfaced online

title: Aligarh court rejects police closure report against RJD spokesperson accused of tearing Manusmriti on live TV
content: The court’s order came on a protest petition filed by Bharat Tiwari, secretary of the Rashtriya Savarna Parishad

title: Government to release ₹600 crore for RTF; Federation calls off stir
content: The ₹600 crore being released is towards the already generated tokens and future payments will be streamlined to avoid accumulating dues, Deputy Chief Minister Bhatti Vikramarka said

title: 1 crore SVAMITVA property cards to be distributed to owners by March 2026
content: These legal ownership documents help reduce land disputes, enable villagers to access bank loans by monetising property, and strengthen panchayat-level governance through reliable property registers, says SVAMITVAA Director

title: Father raises suspicion over death of Jadavpur University student, police presses murder charges
content: Arnab Mondal, the father of the deceased third year English Honours student, says his daughter did not know how to swim, and asks why she would go to the edge of the waterbody on the campus around 10 p.m.

title: Kashmir’s fruit markets shut down over prolonged highway closure
content: Parcel train service launched to take apples from Valley to New Delhi; However, fruit growers say it is inadequate as huge stocks remain stranded on roads; CM blames Centre for delay in road work

title: Watch: ‘Old templates won’t work with China’, says T.S. Tirumurti on India-China ties
content: The launch of China: Indian Perspectives by The Hindu Publishing Group, curated by Ananth Krishnan, saw former Indian UN envoy T.S. Tirumurti speak on rethinking India’s China strategy. The event was also attended by N. Ram, Nirmala Lakshman, B. Santhanam, Suresh Nambath, Narayan Lakshman, and Stanly Johny.

title: UGC gets 8 weeks to include norms on tackling caste bias
content: The top court was hearing a plea filed by the mothers of Rohith Vemula and Payal Tadvi, who died by suicide after facing caste-based harassment at their colleges

title: Centre faces backlash for blocking Sikh pilgrims’ visit to Nankana Sahib in Pakistan
content: In communication to State governments, the Ministry of Home Affairs said, “taking into account the prevailing security scenario with Pakistan, it would not be possible to send Sikh pilgrims Jatha to Pakistan”

title: SC on anticipatory bail in caste crime
content: Supreme Court cancels anticipatory bail granted to a caste crime accused, upholding Section 18 of the SC/ST Act; the ruling reinforces protection for Dalit victims, bars pre-trial relief, and warns courts against conducting a ‘mini-trial’ at the bail stage

title: From October 1, only Aadhaar users can book reserved train tickets online during first 15 minutes
content: The tickets can be booked through the website of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) and its app

title: ED says it has secured over 94% conviction rate in PMLA cases
content: The central probe agency has set the target of achieving ₹15,000-crore restitution this financial year

title: Engineers play significant role in nation-building, say experts
content: They recall the historical contributions of engineers in irrigation projects and industrial growth of the country and make special references to projects such as Himayatsagar Dam and Srisailam Dam

title: Congress accuses government of ‘gifting’ 1,050 acres of land in Bihar’s Bhagalpur to Gautam Adani
content: At a press conference in Delhi, senior Congress leader Pawan Khera accused the government of withdrawing from the project in favour of Adani

title: Andhra Pradesh Governor says India lags behind in the participation of women in politics
content: The law to reserve 33% of the seats in State Assemblies and in the Lok Sabha for women would now enable their greater participation in policy-making and equitable governance, Justice (Retd) Nazeer said

title: Tamil Nadu Electricity Minister Sivasankar seeks a new comprehensive debt restructuring scheme for discoms
content: In his special address at the Group of Ministers meeting of the State Electricity Ministers in New Delhi, he also calls for special grants under the 16th Finance Commission. He says that in the next five to seven years, Tamil Nadu will need over ₹2,00,000 crore in investment across generation, transmission, and distribution

title: ED files charge sheet against Chhattisgarh ex-CM Bhupesh Baghel’s son Chaitanya
content: The case pertains to a loss of ₹2,161 crore to the State’s exchequer allegedly by a syndicate of senior bureaucrats, politicians, and excise department officials when Mr. Bhupesh was the Chief Minister.

title: Arpana’s long wait for a donor heart
content: Arpana from Nepal reached India six months ago and has been waiting for a donor heart for the past four months, having registered in the organ transplant waiting list

title: Insurance company officer sentenced to 10 years RI for misappropriating ₹5.3 crore
content: A CBI Special Court convicts Administrative Officer (Accounts) of Oriental Insurance Co. Ltd., Divisional Office, T. Pradeep of misappropriation

title: India gets licence to scour new part of Indian Ocean for precious metals
content: The government has signed a contract with International Seabed Authority to explore polymetallic sulphur nodules in the Carlsberg Ridge, a 3,00,000-sq km stretch that lies in the Indian Ocean

title: Tribals in Odisha tiger reserve allege they are being ‘fraudulently’ relocated
content: The Union Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change has ordered a probe into allegations that consent was ‘fraudulently’ obtained

title: SWR’s ‘Operation Meri Saheli’ reaches over 2 lakh solo women travellers in 2025
content: Launched in November 2020 by Indian Railways, the initiative focuses on providing assistance from the time of boarding until the completion of the journey

title: Madras High Court grants interim bail to Devanathan Yadav in Mylapore Hindu Permanent Fund case
content: Justice G. Jayachandran directs petitioner to mobilise ₹100 crore on his own and deposit it with the special court for TANPID cases in Chennai

title: Army launches rescue operations in flood-hit villages of Maharashtra
content: According to the Indian Army, responding to a request from the District Collector, Beed, the Indian Army launched Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) operations to rescue stranded residents.

title: Andhra Pradesh grapples with U.S. shrimp tariff, threatening aquaculture sector
content: The state continues to make strides in agriculture, industry, infrastructure, energy, tourism, and welfare, say officials

title: KPCC meeting outwardly muted over Mamkootathil’s attendance in Assembly
content: There appears to be a consensus among top leaders that the Congress MLA’s “surprise attendance” in the Assembly had helped the ruling front in directing the day’s news cycle away from issues plaguing the government.

title: Surging merchandise exports, falling imports cut India’s August trade deficit by half
content: India’s total exports increased to $69.2 billion in August 2025, up 9.3% over its level in August last year

title: Pressure politics builds up in Bihar before seat-sharing in INDIA and NDA camps
content: With the Assembly elections around the corner, parties in both the ruling and Opposing camps are making announcements on candidates and the number of seats they wish to contest, making allies and rivals uneasy

title: INS Nistar makes maiden port call at Singapore for multinational submarine rescue exercise
content: Commissioned on July 18, 2025, the INS Nistar is a testament to India’s growing self-reliance in shipbuilding, having achieved over 80% indigenisation

title: Collective condemns proposed Wildlife Amendment Bill
content: Bill represents political misrepresentation, ecological irresponsibility and statutory bypassing of expert authority, says ‘Coexistence Collective, Kerala’

title: Heartline programme to be launched for Kalyana Karnataka region tomorrow
content: It is aimed at reducing STEMI deaths, a sensitive form of cardiac arrest, while KKRDB will provide 32 advanced ambulances for the scheme

title: Andhra Pradesh achieved 10.80% GSDP growth rate due to collective efforts, says Finance Minister
content: Payyavula Keshav urges officials to sustain this momentum by focusing on planning, welfare, and meeting people’s needs. Revenue and Health Ministers outline steps to prevent land irregularities, ensure proper industrial land use, and expand health insurance coverage

title: NH-2 in Manipur not to reopen till agreement is reached with Meitei people: Kuki-Zo Council
content: The Council rescinds the pact it had signed with the Union Home Ministry on September 4, 2025 for the reopening of the highway and warns against violation of buffer zones; a senior government official says the KZC is playing with words to confuse the people

title: Centre criticised for allowing India to play Asia Cup cricket match with Pakistan
content: The Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister asks whether the match was important, though Pahalgam terror victims opposed it

title: "We Must Unite": Arab, Muslim Leaders Urge Review Of Israel Ties After Doha Strike
content: Arab and Muslim leaders called for a review of ties with Israel after emergency talks in Doha on Monday following last week's deadly strike on Hamas members in the Qatari capital.

title: Trump Says US Again Targeted Boat Allegedly Carrying Drugs From Venezuela
content: President Donald Trump says the U.S. military again targeted a boat allegedly carrying drugs from Venezuela, killing three aboard the vessel.

title: Income Tax Return Deadline Extended, It Can Now Be Filed Till Today
content: The deadline for filing Income Tax returns has been extended by a day to Tuesday, the Centre announced late on Monday night.

title: "Is It Not India?" Rahul Gandhi To Cop When Stopped From Visiting Punjab Village
content: The Congress on Monday accused the Punjab Police of not allowing party leader Rahul Gandhi to meet flood-affected villagers across the Ravi river in Gurdaspur district.

title: Haryana To Hand Over ITO Barrage: Delhi Steps Up Yamuna Flood Management
content: The Haryana government has given in-principle approval for the Delhi government to take over the ITO barrage, senior officials confirmed Monday.

title: Kuki Body Denies Centre's Announcement Of Free Movement In Manipur
content: The Kuki Zo Council (KZC) which recently met the Centre has denied allowing free movement on National Highway-2. The KZC's announcement has created confusion since the Centre had in a statement said the KZC "decided to open National Highway-2".

title: Delhi Registers Decline In Birth Rate, Sex Ratio: Report
content: The sex ratio in Delhi declined to 920 females per thousand males in 2024 as compared to 922 in the previous year, according to an official report.

title: Row Over 'Siropa' Honour For Rahul Gandhi At Gurdwara, Sikh Body Steps In
content: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) chief Harjinder Singh Dhami on Monday said it will probe the matter of honouring Congress leader Rahul Gandhi at historic gurdwara Baba Budha Sahib in Ramdas area in Amritsar.

title: Telangana Colleges Go On Strike, Hospitals To Begin One Over Dues
content: Telangana is facing a dual crisis in its healthcare and education sectors as private colleges have launched an indefinite strike and private hospitals will begin one on Tuesday, demanding the immediate payment of long-pending government dues.

title: Thousands Of Tonnes Of Apples Rot In Trucks Stranded On Srinagar-Jammu Highway
content: As thousands of tons of apple rot in trucks stranded along the Srinagar-Jammu National highway, distressed farmers launched protests and shut fruit markets across Jammu and Kashmir.

title: CBI Raids Premises Of Karnataka Ex-Minister's Relatives In Valmiki Corporation Case
content: The CBI on Monday conducted searches at 16 locations across Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh in connection with the alleged siphoning off government funds from the Karnataka Maharshi Valmiki Scheduled Tribes Development Corporation Limited (KMVSTDCL).

title: 2 Men Posing As Cops Steal Gold, Rs 20 Lakh Cash From Gold Smelting Shop In Delhi: Cops
content: Two men posing as police officers allegedly looted more than Rs 20 lakh in cash and 1.4 kg of gold from a gold smelting shop in Delhi's Farsh Bazar area on Monday, police said.

title: Probe Agency Files Prosecution Complaint In Sahara Group Money Laundering Case
content: The Enforcement Directorate filed a prosecution complaint earleir this month under Section 44 of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act in connection with the Sahara Group case.

title: 2-Year-Old Boy Dies After Falling Into Manhole In Gurugram: Police
content: A two-year-old boy died after falling into a manhole in Gurugram's Sector 65 near IFFCO Chowk on Monday, police said.

title: 3 Killed As Drunk Driver Ploughs Truck Into Crowd, Vehicles In Indore
content: A truck driven by a drunk man ploughed into pedestrians and vehicles in Indore, leaving at least three people dead and several others critically injured.

title: Samajwadi Party MLA Ramakant Yadav Gets 1-Year Jail In 2006 Road Blockade Case
content: An MP-MLA court on Monday sentenced Samajwadi Party MLA Ramakant Yadav to one year rigorous imprisonment in a case registered against him in 2006 for blocking a road during a protest.

title: Xi's Show Of Unity With Putin, Kim Could Complicate China's Diplomatic Balance
content: If the purpose of a rarejoint appearanceof the leaders of Russia, North Korea and China on Sept. 3, 2025, was to foster unity among allies, then early indicators suggest its already working  just elsewhere.

title: Teacher Thrashes Students With Stick For Not Touching Her Feet, Suspended
content: A government teacher in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district was suspended for allegedly thrashing 31 students with a bamboo stick for not touching her feet after the morning prayers.

title: Electrician Dies By Suicide, Jumps From 24th Floor In Bengaluru
content: A 26-year-old electrician, who has been living in Bengaluru, died by suicide after jumping from the 24th floor on Sunday evening.

title: Virginia Tech fires Brent Pry: Top candidates, transfers and recruits to watch
content: the Virginia Tech Hokies fired coach Brent Pry after a 0-3 start to the season . Pry was supposed to represent a return to the Frank Beamer glory years in blacksburg . but a bowl game in 2023 and a faceplant to start this season closed the curtain for Pry .

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the WNBA playoffs are finally here . the first round is a 1-1-1 format, with the higher seed hosting Game 1 and Game 3 . if necessary, the finals will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) format .

title: DeShaun Foster is out at UCLA; here's who could take over the Bruins
content: alum deShaun Foster was elevated late in the 2023-24 coaching carousel . the school fired Foster after an 0-3 start in which the Bruins were outscored 108-43 . he is a former assistant and standout running back in the NFL .

title: College football betting lines: Texas Tech, Utah head into ranked Big 12 clash
content: no team has ever started the season 0-3 and held onto a top-25 ranking . there will be three ranked matchups, as no. 17 Texas Tech faces no. 16 Utah , no. 22 Auburn takes on no. 11 Oklahoma , and no. 9 Illinois match up against no. 19 Indiana .

title: NFL Week 3 betting: Odds, lines and totals for every game
content: the Miami Dolphins host the Buffalo Bills on "Thursday Night Football" on tuesday . a matchup of undefeated teams will feature the New York Giants and the Kansas City Chiefs . the team is the biggest favorite on the week 3 slate .

title: What has gone wrong for the Mets? Breaking down their second-half woes
content: the new york Mets beat the Milwaukee Brewers 5-2 in the wild-card series . a 3-run walk-off homer in the 10th inning was the biggest for the Mets in their past nine games . it wasn't the biggest hit of Pete Alonso's career, but his homer was certainly the biggest .

title: Takeaways from every game: Eagles defeat Chiefs in Super Bowl rematch
content: the Packers beat the Commanders in the first overtime game of the season . the Patriots eclipsed 30 points for the first time since 2021 in their tight win over the Dolphins . in the early window Sunday, the Bills and Ravens dominated the Jets and Browns after their head-to-head thriller last Sunday .

title: 'More wins': Mayfield hungry in Year 3 with the Bucs
content: field Yates explains why he's dropping Baker Mayfield to QB15 in fantasy for week 2 . he was the leading rusher for both teams by the game's end . Mayfield went 3-for-10 on passes of 15 or more air yards in the first quarter .

title: C.J. Stroud learning how to balance life and faith with being face of the Texans
content: Texans quarterback C.J. Stroud was coming off a season in which he admitted that the fun was missing at times in football . he focused mainly on football, family and his faith . the approach was clear: stay out of the spotlight as much as possible .

title: Top players discuss playoff format, cheat meals, hype-up music
content: the NHL is close to being back in action for the 2025-26 season . a new collective bargaining agreement has been signed between the league and the players . "cheat meals," pregame pump-up tunes and weird equipment quirks are among the favorites .

title: Fighters' grades: Did Crawford or Inoue have the better weekend?
content: three of ESPN's top 10 pound-for-pound fighters were in action this weekend . no. 3 Terence Crawford clashed with no. 8 canelo alvarez at Allegiant Stadium . Naoya Inoue put his undisputed junior featherweight titles on the line against murodjon Akhmadaliev .

title: 🏈 College Football Power Rankings after Week 3
content: college football's breakout stars are on display in the 2025 college football landscape . big Ten powers Ohio State, Penn State and Oregon all took care of business with help from their early standouts in Week 3 . the big Ten giants leaned on their new starting quarterbacks in an overtime classic .

title: From reassurance to accountability, who said what in Week 2?
content: Philadelphia Eagles vs. Kansas City Chiefs Game Highlights (1:00) NFL Week 2 saw plenty of close endings and wild moments that produced memorable quips. Along with a rematch of Super Bowl LIX between the  Philadelphia Eagles  and  Kansas City Chiefs , the  Detroit Lions  faced one of their former coaches in Chicago, the  Dallas Cowboys  picked up their first win and the  Miami Dolphins  continued to struggle. But following each respective matchup, players and coaches were open and vocal in their reactions. Can you correctly guess who said what? See how locked in you were during Week 2 below:

title: Why Brentford's goal vs. Chelsea wasn't ruled out for offside; Maddison's VAR rage
content: Steve Nicol defends Mohamed Salah from criticisms of his overall play . the video assistant referee causes controversy every week in the premier league . we take a look at the major incidents in terms of VAR protocol and the Laws of the Game .
